intro: Elaeosticta hirtula, commonly known as the hairy elaeosticta, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Elaeosticta hirtula is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
